Title: Data Analyst (B2C) (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable use of data to drive fast, accurate decision making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

Our B2C business is the backbone of our success. We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our business operations by delivering consistent, accurate measurement of performance across all domains, from regular management reporting and deep dives, through finance and fraud reporting, to ad-hoc insights for e.g. PR and Communications purposes.

Key Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build dashboards to support efficient dissemination of the above trends
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


Passionate about continuous improvement.
An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.


A Successful Candidate Will Have


Minimum 3 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Experienced in using SQL extensively
Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
Bonus points if you have:
Knowledge of Looker development
Basic knowledge of Python

Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Position: Quantitative Analyst

Location: Berlin, Germany

Language: Professional German minimum




Our client is one of Germany's largest power producers supplying energy to millions of households & companies all across Germany. They are currently looking for a Master / PhD grad with a background in Math, Computer Science or Engineering with strong interest in quantitative analsysis for the European Energy markets.




Their ideal match:

Completed education in physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or economics (master, diploma, or PhD level)
Very strong quantitative and analytical skills as well as deep understanding of stochastic calculus, optimization methods, and data science techniques
Experience in quantitative modeling and pricing of commodity options and PPA products is advantageous
Advanced expertise in object-oriented programming (ideally in Python)
Experience in modern cloud IT stacks (e.g. Gitlab CICD, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS) is advantageous
Team player with excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Proactive entrepreneurial attitude, strong orientation on results with a commercial mindset, and ability to work independently and under time pressure
Very good command of written and spoken English, knowledge of additional languages is a plus




Your tasks:

Quantitative analysis of the European energy market and its price drivers
Provision of quantitative view on market dynamics to traders (e.g. through volatilities, sensitivities and correlations)
Development and application of mathematical models and tools used for commercial decision making in the realm of product pricing and hedging, position management and market analytics
Refactoring of existing framework for dispatch optimization across all relevant time frames from day-ahead until 3 years ahead in close cooperation with IT
Analysis, calibration and improvement of quantitative models required for options trading and green power business
Close cooperation and development of efficient working relationships with traders, peer analysts, as well as colleagues from risk management and other departments to ensure optimal information flow and decision making




What they can offer:

With flexible working hours and models, a regulation for mobile work, and a pleasant working atmosphere.
30-days of vacation
Diverse training opportunities and personal development chances
Attractive social benefits, such as company pension schemes, health offers
In-house employee restaurant, bike leasing program, and other employee benefits
Show more

  • Team player with excellent communication and problem-solving skills

  • Analysis, calibration and improvement of quantitative models required for options trading and green power business

What they can offer:

  • With flexible working hours and models, a regulation for mobile work, and a pleasant working atmosphere.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
About AccountableAccountable is revolutionising financial management for the self-employed. Our platform simplifies taxes, accounting, and financial administration for the self-employed - and we're even expanding into banking. With a proven product and a growing customer base, we are now looking for a Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision making.




About the role




As a data analyst, you will play a critical role in optimising conversion to paid, ARPA, and monetisation strategies by running deep analyses, translating complex data into actionable recommendations and driving experimentation. Additionally, you will support our Performance Marketing team by identifying patterns, improving marketing efficiency, and helping optimise our key metrics.


Tasks


Key Responsibilities
Revenue Growth & Experimentation (80%)





Analyse conversion funnels, pricing models, and customer behaviour to proactively identify revenue growth opportunities.


Identify friction points in the user journey and recommend data-backed optimisations.


Oversee tracking of key revenue metrics, including Conversion to paid, ARPA, cost of acquisition (CAC), lifetime value (LTV), Churn, and Retention in the company.


Build dashboards and visualisations to provide real-time insights to the company.


Take part in the Revenue Growth meeting, to come up with and implement data-driven growth experiments.


Support A/B testing and experimentation within the company, ensuring statistical analysis of results.





Performance Marketing Support (20%)





Identify patterns in user acquisition that can help optimise performance marketing campaigns.


Analyse and recommend levers to improve LTV & CAC.


Work with the Performance Marketing team to refine audience targeting and budget allocation.


Help the Content Marketing Team with data requests to enrich their content operations.





A quick word about data infrastructure




At Accountable, data is currently hosted in different services:





Our own database & its analytical datalake


Amplitude (user in-app events & visualization)


Intercom (CRM)


BigQuery (ETL engine)


Gsheet & Looker (visualization)





It will be expected of you that you can retrieve, combine & analyze data from those different sources to come up with the relevant insights.




We are constantly looking at ways to do things better and will likely, thanks to your help, improve this infrastructure.


Requirements


Who you are





Data-driven problem solver





Using programs such as Amplitude and Spreadsheets, you can turn raw data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.





Growth & experimentation mindset





You understand A/B testing, conversion optimisation, and monetisation strategies.





Business & product sense





You have great intuition when it comes to building product & having a meaningful impact for the company/our users.





Technical skills





Proficiently in basic programming (Python)





Proactive & collaborative





You take ownership, work independently, and thrive in cross-functional teams.





Bonus: marketing analytics experience





You understand digital marketing metrics, CAC/LTV, and how to optimise acquisition strategies.




Requirements





Based in Berlin


Fluent in German


A university degree in Data Analysis or a related field is preferred


Min. 3 years of experience in Data Analytics



Benefits


Why join Accountable?




🌍 Work at a fast-growing fintech that’s making self-employment easier.




🥊 Make a direct impact on the growth and profitability of our business.




🎯 Join a data-driven culture that believes in rapid iteration, and making decisions based on data.




💡You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.




🤝 Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Show more

💡You will have the freedom to drive your own projects and influence key business decisions.


🤝 Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to bring data to life.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Healthcare Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Als Data Analyst für Healthcare Analytics bist du Teil von Beratungsteams bei Klienten sowie von internen Projekten, Recherchen und Analysen zu Unternehmen und Trends in den europäischen Gesundheitssystemen. Wir sind Teil von McKinseys globalem Client Capability Network (client capability network) mit mehr als 7.000 Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die unsere Klienten und Beratungsteams mit Expertise und Branchenanalysen unterstützen. Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Deutschland suchen wir dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Data Analyst für Healthcare Analytics.

Das Healthcare Analytics Team nutzt Analysen und Daten aus dem Gesundheitswesen (z.B. Krankenversicherungen oder Gesundheitseinrichtungen), um einige der dringendsten Herausforderungen unserer Klienten zu beantworten, wie zum Beispiel „Wie können wir die Kosten der Gesundheitsversorgung optimieren und gleichzeitig die Qualität verbessern?“, „Wie können wir mit KI/ML Prozesse optimieren und bspw. Rechnungsbetrug automatisiert erkennen?“, „Wer sind die sensibelsten Patientengruppen und mit welchen Behandlungspfaden können wir ihre Versorgung verbessern?“

Healthcare Analytics ist ein Team innerhalb der SHaPE-Practice (Social, Healthcare and Public Entities) mit Fokus auf der spezialisierten Beratung von Einrichtungen des Gesundheitswesens, insbesondere Kostenträgern. Unser Ziel ist es, mit der Unterstützung von Advanced Analytics, KI sowie unseren standardisierten Methoden für Diagnostik, Optimierung und Implementierung für unsere Klienten positive und nachhaltige Veränderung zu erzielen.

Your Impact

In der Rolle als Data Analyst in Healthcare Analytics unterstützt du unsere Beratungsteams mit quantitativen Analysen sowie KI/ML-Ansätzen und entwickelst unser Portfolio an datengetriebenen Lösungen und innovativen Lösungsansätzen kontinuierlich weiter.

Du wirst eng mit unseren Klienten aus verschiedenen Bereichen wie Krankenversicherungen, Leistungserbringern oder Private Equity zusammenarbeiten und dabei deine Fähigkeiten im Projektmanagement und in der Kommunikation mit diversen Stakeholdern einsetzen.

Im Healthcare Analytics Team handeln wir unternehmerisch. Daher suchen wir jemanden mit der Motivation, kontinuierlich den Status Quo zu verbessern und dies auch eigenständig voranzutreiben.

Als Data Analyst wird von dir erwartet, dass du Erfahrung im Umgang mit großen Datensätzen, insbesondere in der Analyse und Modellierung, mitbringst. Idealerweise hast du auch Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Künstliche Intelligenz (KI) und Maschinelles Lernen (ML). Erste Erfahrungen im Gesundheitswesen, wie z.B. bei Krankenversicherungen oder Leistungserbringern, sind von Vorteil. Du solltest Begeisterung für quantitative Analysen zeigen und Interesse daran haben, dich in diesen Bereichen weiterzubilden und zusätzliche Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten zu erwerben.

Deine täglichen Aufgaben umfassen die Analyse und Modellierung großer Datensätze sowie die enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Data Engineers beim Aufbau und der Pflege unserer McKinsey Big Data Plattform. Du wirst Dashboards und ML/KI-Modelle entwickeln, wobei du sowohl Low-Code/No-Code-Tools als auch Python und Visualisierungstools nutzen kannst. Im täglichen Geschäft arbeitest du eng mit unseren Data Engineering Kollegen, dem Capabilities and Insights Team sowie unseren Beratungsteams zusammen, um die Kundenarbeit vorzubereiten und durchzuführen.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Mit sehr gutem Erfolg abgeschlossenes Master- oder Promotionsstudium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Studiengang mit Fokus auf Data Analytics/Science oder in einem MINT-Fach; ein Bezug zum Gesundheitswesen ist von Vorteil, aber nicht zwingend erforderlich
2+ Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem relevanten Bereich (z.B. Data Analytics/ Science, Business Intelligence oder Beratung)
Grundkenntnisse in mindestens einem BI-Tool wie Tableau und PowerBI
Grundkenntnisse in einer Programmiersprache wie Python, SQL oder Äquivalent
Affinität für Daten und Analysen, sowie idealerweise Erfahrung in der Qualitätssicherung und Strukturierung von Daten
Leidenschaft für gesundheitsbezogene Themen
Ausgezeichnete Problemlösungsfähigkeiten, insbesondere im analytischen und quantitativen Bereich
Ausgeprägtes unternehmerisches Handeln mit der Motivation, kontinuierlich den Status Quo zu verbessern und dies auch eigenständig voranzutreiben
Einsatzbereitschaft, Zielstrebigkeit, Initiative und Kreativität
Reisebereitschaft von bis zu 80%
Du arbeitest gern im Team, bist kontaktfreudig und überzeugst durch sicheres Auftreten
Überzeugende schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikation in Deutsch und Englisch
Show more

  • Mit sehr gutem Erfolg abgeschlossenes Master- oder Promotionsstudium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Studiengang mit Fokus auf Data Analytics/Science oder in einem MINT-Fach; ein Bezug zum Gesundheitswesen ist von Vorteil, aber nicht zwingend erforderlich
  • 2+ Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem relevanten Bereich (z.B. Data Analytics/ Science, Business Intelligence oder Beratung)
  • Grundkenntnisse in mindestens einem BI-Tool wie Tableau und PowerBI
  • Grundkenntnisse in einer Programmiersprache wie Python, SQL oder Äquivalent
  • Affinität für Daten und Analysen, sowie idealerweise Erfahrung in der Qualitätssicherung und Strukturierung von Daten
  • Leidenschaft für gesundheitsbezogene Themen
  • Ausgezeichnete Problemlösungsfähigkeiten, insbesondere im analytischen und quantitativen Bereich
  • Ausgeprägtes unternehmerisches Handeln mit der Motivation, kontinuierlich den Status Quo zu verbessern und dies auch eigenständig voranzutreiben
  • Einsatzbereitschaft, Zielstrebigkeit, Initiative und Kreativität
  • Reisebereitschaft von bis zu 80%
  • Du arbeitest gern im Team, bist kontaktfreudig und überzeugst durch sicheres Auftreten
  • Überzeugende schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikation in Deutsch und Englisch

Title: Data Analyst*in
Description:
Data Analyst*in (m/w/d)

DKB AG

Standort: Berlin

unbefristet

Teil- & Vollzeit (38h/Woche)

ab sofort

Deine Aufgaben


Du arbeitest im Bereich Business Intelligence in einem interdisziplinären Team von Expert*innen und gestaltest dort als Data Analyst unsere Dateninfrastruktur von morgen mit
Du bist Sparringspartner*in für den*die Product Owner*in unserer Cloud Data Platform und führst Workshops zur Auftragsklärung und Anforderungsspezifikation durch
Du lernst die Datenbedarfe diverser Projekte und Fachbereiche kennen und leitest fachliche Vorgaben für die Bereitstellung benötigter Daten durch unsere Cloud Data Platform ab
Du analysierst DKB-interne und externe Datenquellen und definierst fachliche Regeln und Rahmenbedingungen für eine Datenintegration
Du führst zusammen mit unserem Testmanagement Tests zur Sicherstellung der fehlerfreien Verarbeitung neuer Artefakte in der Cloud Data Platform durch
Du kooperierst eng mit unseren Data Engineers und mit Expert*innen zu den Themen Datenarchitektur, Datenmodellierung, Data Governance, Datenqualität und Datenschutz
Du nutzt einen cloud-basierten Toolstack, arbeitest in einem agilen Setup für die Cloud Data Platform und bringst dich darüber hinaus in unserer Data Analyst Community ein


Dein Profil


Du hast deinen Bachelor oder Master in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang in der Tasche und bringst bereits relevante Berufserfahrung als Business Analyst*in oder Data Analyst*in mit
Mit deinen Erfahrungen im Anforderungsmanagement kannst du komplexe Aufgaben verstehen, priorisieren und sie im Team lösen
Du weißt, wie eine Bank funktioniert und es interessiert dich, wie ihre Bereiche mit den für sie relevanten Daten versorgt werden
Kenntnisse in SQL und Python bringst du mit
Neue Ideen selbstständig und eigenverantwortlich umzusetzen ist für dich selbstverständlich
S3 und Redshift sowie Jira und Confluence sind keine Fremdwörter für dich


Die DKB steht für Vielfalt und Chancengerechtigkeit. Egal, woher du kommst, wie alt du bist, welches Geschlecht, welche Genderidentität, sexuelle Orientierung oder Religion du hast, ob mit oder ohne Behinderung - wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Deine Benefits und mehr


Attraktive Vergütung (tariflich oder außertariflich)
Flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten – temporär auch im EU-Ausland
Du hast die Wahl: Benefits Pass, Jobticket oder Jobrad
Moderne Technik- ausstattung und Tool Stack
Individuelle Qualifi- zierungsmöglichkeiten
Duz-Kultur und kein Dresscode
Externe Mitarbeitenden- beratung
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben
Weitere Extras wie z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Versicherungsschutz


Immer für dich ansprechbar

Kristina Fink

Expertise Lead

kristina.fink@dkb.de

Deutsche Kreditbank AG

Du möchtest mehr zur DKB erfahren?

Dann schau auf unserer Karriereseite vorbei.
Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Analyst (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Internship Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We're looking for a motivated Data Analyst Intern to join our Machine Learning team and support various data-driven initiatives. You’ll work with large datasets, improve data quality, and help build dashboards and reports to support business decisions. This is a hands-on opportunity to gain experience with cloud technologies and BI tools in a fast-paced startup environment.




Start: ASAP | Location: Remote/hybrid possible




For at least 6 months.


Tasks


Your Responsibilities:





Design Looker Studio dashboards tailored to business needs


Collaborate with Data Engineers: create tickets, track progress, validate outputs


Perform quality checks on existing data pipelines


Implement a data warehouse layer using predefined schema and basic ETL processes


Import and transform data in Looker Studio and support teams with dashboard setup


Support data cleanup efforts to ensure accuracy and consistency


Assist departments like Customer Success, Finance, Product, and Marketing with analytics



Requirements



Basic experience with GCP or other cloud platforms


Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating data


Basic understanding of Python


Experience with data visualization and analytics


Strong analytical thinking and good communication skills





Nice to Have:





Experience with data quality checks and pipeline validation


Knowledge of Looker Studio, BigQuery, ETL, or data warehousing


Understanding of customer and financial analytics



Benefits


Join Airteam!




Work with a fun, international team in a cool co-working space in the heart of Berlin. We offer flexible hours, hybrid work, and even workations. You’ll have the freedom to share your ideas and make an impact. Plus, we love team events and always support your well-being.




Apply now and become part of our team!

Title: Working Student Data Analysis (m/w/d) Berlin, Hamburg, München
Description:
1KOMMA5°

We are looking for you to join our tech team in Berlin, Munich, or Hamburg. 1KOMMA5° is creating Germany's largest one-stop-shop for the sale, installation, and servicing of solar panels, heat pumps, electricity solutions, and charging infrastructure. And the best part? These assets are seamlessly integrated into the energy market, and we are focused on optimizing their performance to maximize their impact. Be a part of our mission and shape the base of our tech products - the integrations!

Become a part of our mission and learn more about our Product & Tech team!

Deine Position

As part of a cross-functional team in the Heartbeat Tech domain, you will focus on analysing data passing through our interfaces to find errors and discrepancies, identify the root cause of these and then generate solutions to increase data accuracy. By doing this you will play an integral role in making the Heartbeat AI more robust and provide a high platform stability and exceptional customer experience.

Key Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Technical Contribution: Make sense of large data sets and identify unexpected behavior. Take an active approach in trying to understand possible root causes for this unexpected behavior identified and present this in a succinct and efficient manner
Collaboration: Ingest data from other teams and discuss your findings with them directly. Challenge other people and processes and be challenged
Optimization: Become an expert in the workings of our optimization and use data to explain system behavior internally and externally
Innovation Initiatives: Contribute to fostering a culture of innovation and experimentation within the team to continuously improve our products and processes. Drive these initiatives together with internal and external stakeholders towards rapid execution to manifest 1KOMMA5° leading role in the market


Dein Profil

The Successful Candidate Will Have


Enrolled at a university and contribute 20 hours per week
Studying a relevant degree program (e.g., Engineering, Computer Science)
Strong communication and organisational skills
Experience with SQL, BigQuery, SQLMesh
Experience refining ambiguous requirements and finding your way around in cross-functional teams in a fast pace, interdisciplinary working environment
An agile and result-oriented mindset and you consider yourself a team player
Comfortable owning tasks and work streams from day one
Very good knowledge of spoken and written English (German is a plus)


Bonus Points For


Knowledge around the Energy markets, products or ecosystem
Experience and interest in climate tech industry


Benefits


You are part of a dynamic and highly motivated team with people who have proven that they can make things happen and move companies forward
With your work, you accelerate the "energy and mobility transition" and make a concrete contribution to the sustainable transformation of our energy infrastructure
You move in flat hierarchies and have direct contact with the managing directors as well as short decision-making paths
Work with and learn from other skilled engineers
You work remotely (Germany-wide), with offices in Berlin, Hamburg or Munich
See the direct impact of your work on a rapid-scaling user base
Create a healthy balance alongside your work and enjoy all the benefits of the EGYM Wellpass


Über uns

Die 1KOMMA5° Gruppe ist ein CleanTech Unicorn mit der Mission alles zu elektrifizieren und über unsere KI-basierte Software Plattform Heartbeat AI jeden an den Strommarkt der Zukunft anzuschließen. Wir sind das marktführende Unternehmen für die Installation von CO2-neutralen Energiesystemen, insbesondere bei Photovoltaik, Energiespeicher, Wallbox, Wärmepumpe und Energiemanagement. 1KOMMA5° vereint die besten Unternehmen Deutschlands, Europas und darüber hinaus - wir wachsen weiter und das weltweit.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst I - Hospitality Data Team
Description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

Lightspeed is rapidly growing, and we're looking for a skilled Data Analyst I to join our expanding Hospitality Data Team within the product department. As strategic data partners, this team works closely with Product Managers, Designers, and Developers to deliver actionable insights that guide product development and strategic decisions. Your contributions will directly impact product performance and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategy, helping to drive overall company growth through data-driven solutions.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with Product Managers, Developers, Designers, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights and support, contributing to product and business strategy.
Support Data Analysis: Perform analyses such as customer segmentation, customer health analysis, and impact measurement of product development initiatives using Python and SQL.
Contribute to Data Warehouse Management: Help manage and maintain our data warehouse, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and accessible for downstream analysis, particularly in cloud environments such as BigQuery.
DynamoDB Data Extraction and Visualization: Assist in accessing DynamoDB to extract relevant data and collaborate on building real-time visualizations that drive informed business decisions.
Dashboard and Report Maintenance: Maintain dashboards using tools like Heap and BigQuery to help teams track KPIs and user behaviors. Collaborate on creating a catalog of reusable dashboards for Product and UX teams.
Segment Collaboration: Support in setting up, maintaining, and testing the Segment customer data platform, aligning it with our data strategy and objectives.
Foster a Data-Driven Culture: Contribute to fostering a data-driven culture within the team by sharing insights, promoting best practices, and assisting team members with data analysis challenges.
Work in an Agile Environment: Collaborate effectively in an agile environment, working closely with cross-functional teams to meet dynamic business needs and deliver data insights in line with product development cycles.



Experience

What You'll Bring:


2-3+ years of experience in Python, with strong capabilities in data analysis and scripting.
2-3+ years of experience in SQL, with experience in BigQuery and Dataform as a plus.
Familiarity with Customer Data Platforms like Segment and analytics tools like Heap.

Technical Skills


Python Proficiency: Strong ability to script for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis (Pydantic, Scikit-learn, Poetry).
SQL Proficiency: Experience in querying and manipulating data using SQL, with a focus on cloud platforms such as BigQuery.
Data Visualization: Experience building and maintaining dashboards with tools like Heap, Looker, or Google Data Studio.
Version Control: Familiarity with Git and version control best practices.
As a Plus:
Experience working with data warehouses, particularly Dataform or similar data transformation frameworks.
Communication & Collaboration: Strong communication skills, with the ability to present data insights effectively and collaborate with different teams across the organization.
Business Acumen & Problem-Solving: Ability to translate data into actionable business insights that directly inform business strategy and product development.
Teamwork: Collaborative spirit, with the ability to contribute to shared goals within a dynamic, cross-functional, and agile environment.


What’s in it for you


Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices
Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding
Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact
Work on high-traffic products with a global user base
Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story



… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:


Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners).
Flexible working policy.
Mental health online platform and counselling & coaching services.
Health and wellness benefits.
LinkedIn Learning license (learning is always ongoing).
Volunteer day to be able to give back to society!



To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?

Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who We Are

Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

HTML:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

Lightspeed is rapidly growing, and we're looking for a skilled Data Analyst I to join our expanding Hospitality Data Team within the product department. As strategic data partners, this team works closely with Product Managers, Designers, and Developers to deliver actionable insights that guide product development and strategic decisions. Your contributions will directly impact product performance and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategy, helping to drive overall company growth through data-driven solutions.

What You'll Do

  • Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with Product Managers, Developers, Designers, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights and support, contributing to product and business strategy.
  • Support Data Analysis: Perform analyses such as customer segmentation, customer health analysis, and impact measurement of product development initiatives using Python and SQL.
  • Contribute to Data Warehouse Management: Help manage and maintain our data warehouse, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and accessible for downstream analysis, particularly in cloud environments such as BigQuery.
  • DynamoDB Data Extraction and Visualization: Assist in accessing DynamoDB to extract relevant data and collaborate on building real-time visualizations that drive informed business decisions.
  • Dashboard and Report Maintenance: Maintain dashboards using tools like Heap and BigQuery to help teams track KPIs and user behaviors. Collaborate on creating a catalog of reusable dashboards for Product and UX teams.
  • Segment Collaboration: Support in setting up, maintaining, and testing the Segment customer data platform, aligning it with our data strategy and objectives.
  • Foster a Data-Driven Culture: Contribute to fostering a data-driven culture within the team by sharing insights, promoting best practices, and assisting team members with data analysis challenges.
  • Work in an Agile Environment: Collaborate effectively in an agile environment, working closely with cross-functional teams to meet dynamic business needs and deliver data insights in line with product development cycles.


Experience

What You'll Bring:

    • 2-3+ years of experience in Python, with strong capabilities in data analysis and scripting.
    • 2-3+ years of experience in SQL, with experience in BigQuery and Dataform as a plus.
    • Familiarity with Customer Data Platforms like Segment and analytics tools like Heap.
Technical Skills

      • Python Proficiency: Strong ability to script for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis (Pydantic, Scikit-learn, Poetry).
      • SQL Proficiency: Experience in querying and manipulating data using SQL, with a focus on cloud platforms such as BigQuery.
      • Data Visualization: Experience building and maintaining dashboards with tools like Heap, Looker, or Google Data Studio.
      • Version Control: Familiarity with Git and version control best practices.
  • As a Plus:
    • Experience working with data warehouses, particularly Dataform or similar data transformation frameworks.
  • Communication & Collaboration: Strong communication skills, with the ability to present data insights effectively and collaborate with different teams across the organization.
  • Business Acumen & Problem-Solving: Ability to translate data into actionable business insights that directly inform business strategy and product development.
  • Teamwork: Collaborative spirit, with the ability to contribute to shared goals within a dynamic, cross-functional, and agile environment.

What’s in it for you

  • Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices
  • Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding
  • Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact
  • Work on high-traffic products with a global user base
  • Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story


… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:

  • Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners).
  • Flexible working policy.
  • Mental health online platform and counselling & coaching services.
  • Health and wellness benefits.
  • LinkedIn Learning license (learning is always ongoing).
  • Volunteer day to be able to give back to society!

Title: Social Insight Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks


Translate social media conversations and digital trends into clear, actionable insights for key stakeholders across the company
Monitor, analyze, and interpret social media and listening data using platforms like Netbase Quid or similar tools; turn findings into compelling reports and dashboards
Identify emerging trends, audience behaviors, and content patterns to support campaign development and innovation
Collaborate closely with marketing, PR, and sales teams to deliver timely and relevant social insights for both ongoing and upcoming initiatives
Contribute to pitches and client presentations with clear, data-driven storytelling
Continuously evaluate and test new social listening and analytics tools to enhance our insight capabilities
Stay on top of developments in the creator economy and influencer marketing landscape to help shape internal strategies


Your Profile


University degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business Administration, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in market research, data analysis, and social media marketing
Proven analytical skills with hands-on experience in data visualization and interpretation using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R, or a strong willingness to deepen technical skills in this area
Advanced proficiency in social media tracking and listening tools such as Meltwater, Netbase Quid, or comparable platforms
Solid understanding of Generative AI tools and their application in analytics and content strategy
In-depth knowledge of the creator economy and a strong grasp of current social media trends and platform dynamics
Full professional fluency in both German and English, spoken and written
High level of adaptability and drive, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, agile work environment


About Us

We Are Era is the first pan-European studio and talent agency with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Cologne, Copenhagen, Paris, Milan and Stockholm. Our vision? Shaping the zeitgeist in an era of movements - and with success: our productions and campaigns for broadcasters, brands and NGOs have won multiple awards. We create stories with impact and attitude, developed and told by and for people all over Europe. Our projects range from TV productions and fictional series to innovative formats on social video platforms such as YouTube, Instagram, Twitch and TikTok. We develop social influencers and artists into cross-platform personality brands that are now found on social media, on TV, in podcasts, on the big screen or in the music charts. Our international team of 250 speaks all languages - from mainstream to subculture, from the Friday For Future movement to K-pop culture. Together, we offer our partners the fast-lane ticket to every community in Europe. Are you ready to shape the zeitgeist with us? Join the Movement!

Title: (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch)
Description:
Über uns

Getreu unserem Motto – People is what makes us us – sind uns deine nachhaltige Ausbildung und Weiterentwicklung, deine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance und deine Happiness sehr wichtig. Konkret stellen wir mit 32 Urlaubstagen, 60 % mobilem Arbeiten, bis zu 4 Wochen pro Jahr – im europäischen Ausland – der Möglichkeit remote zu arbeiten, Sabbatical und Überstundenausgleich sicher, dass dir im FUSE-Agentur-Leben nichts fehlt.

In unserem derzeit über 60-köpfigen Team sowie unseren Kund*innen haben wir unser perfektes Match bereits gefunden. Wenn du noch auf der Suche bist, bei „popkulturellem Relevanzmarketing“ neugierig wirst und für Social Media, Influencer Marketing oder Gaming & Esports brennst, dann lass uns zusammen loslegen! Denn : Action Creates Impact .

Dein Job

Als (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch) bearbeitest du als Teil unseres Data und Analytics Teams in erster Linie die Anfragen unserer Kunden nach Social Media Reportings sowie Social Listening Analysen und beherrschst den Spagat zwischen analytischem und kreativem Denken, um die Kolleg:Innen in deinem und anderen Teams mit datenbasierten Insights zu Kundenmeinungen, Märkten, Zielgruppen, Marken und ihren Social Media-Umfeldern zu versorgen.

Dein Aufgabenbereich

Datenbeschaffung / Toolbedienung

Du bist präzise, schnell, zuverlässig und motiviert, wenn es um die manuelle Erfassung großer (Social Media)- Datenmengen geht, aber auch wissbegierig und begeisterungsfähig, dich diesbezüglich kontinuierlich mit Prozessoptimierung zu befassen, sowie dich in Tools und automatisierte Datenerfassungsprozesse und Methoden einzudenken, um immer bessere Lösungen zu finden.

Datenstrukturierung, Effiziente Datensammlung, Query Writing, Kategorisierung und Datendarstellung werden hier deine täglichen Begleiter.

Studiendurchführung

Von der (manchmal noch recht schwammigen) Fragestellung bis zum fertigen Analysebericht mit guten Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen ist es oft ein weiter aber spannender Weg. Der kann bald auch deiner sein, gemeinsam mit uns im Team.

Du hast ein sehr gutes Gespür für Sprache und Kommunikation? Nice, das brauchst du hier in mindestens dreierlei Hinsicht: Erstens, um aus den Aussagen und Briefings unserer Auftraggeber herausfiltern zu können, wie du ihnen am besten weiterhelfen kannst. Zweitens, wenn es darum geht, die Essenz von Konsumenten-Posts und Kommentaren auf Social Media zu verstehen, schließlich ist Inhaltanalyse unser Daily-Business. Und Drittens, um dann Deine Findings Zielgruppengerecht rüberzubringen - in Reports, in Meetings und bei Präsentationen.

Datenanalyse

Auswertungslogiken passend zu den gegebenen Fragestellungen und Erkenntnisinteressen erstellen, Dimensionierungen & Kategorisierungen für Inhaltsanalysen planen und entwickeln, Daten auszählen, filtern, darstellen, vergleichen, interpretieren, daraus kreative Idee und Empfehlungen ableiten. Das ist dein Playground. Deine Affinität zu Zahlen und Daten kannst du hier immer wieder beweisen. Ein stets strukturiertes Vorgehen und ein souveräner Umgang auch mit großen und komplexen Datenmengen, Statistiken und Zahlen sind für dich selbstverständlich.

Spezielle Social Media Analyse-Tools wirst Du ebenso (kennenlernen und) zum Einsatz bringen wie ganz viel Excel und das gute alte Powerpoint.

Das bringst du mit

Du kannst (erste) Erfahrung in der qualitativen und quantitativen Forschungsarbeit, sowie in der marketing- oder kundenorientierten Projektarbeit vorweisen und hast Lust dich im Bereich Social Media Analytics weiter auszutoben. Du hast, dank deines Studiums, einen kommunikations-, sozial- oder medienwissenschaftlichen Background und bringst Kenntnisse der Methoden im Bereich der quantitativen und qualitativen Marktforschung mit. Du hast neben den analytischen Fähigkeiten, auch ein Gespür für gute kreative Kommunikation und Lust, diese mitzuentwickeln. Du bist organisiert und selbständig, willst aber auch noch ständig ganz viel lernen und verstehst dich als Teamplayer, der immer auf Höhe des Zeitgeists ist und daraus neue Impulse für unsere Teams und Kunden ableitet. Außerdem hast Du sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse, insbesondere Excel und PowerPoint und bist im besten Fall mit Analytics Tools im Bereich Social Listening & Web Analytics vertraut.

Darum wir

Als Teil der FUSE erfährst du stets Rückenwind von deinem Team, arbeitest für Kunden - die unsere Werte „BOLD. TRUE. EASY. TOGETHER.“ leben und kannst aktiv Prozesse und Strukturen mitentwickeln. Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.

Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Wir sind Eberlein Kunz, ein international agierendes E-Commerce Unternehmen in Berlin. Unser Team besteht aus einer bunt gemischten Crew von 80 kreativen Köpfen, die in den verschiedensten Bereichen wie Logistik, Produktentwicklung, Category Management, Vertrieb, Marketing, Web- und Softwareentwicklung ihre Talente einbringen.

Seit 2013 haben wir uns auf den Online-Vertrieb von erstklassigen Lebensmitteln, Bio- und Naturprodukten, Drogerie- und Beauty-Artikeln, Haushaltswaren sowie Büchern spezialisiert – und das mit großem Erfolg. Unsere jährliche Wachstumsrate bewegt sich zweistellig, und wir zählen mittlerweile zu den Top-Händlern auf dem deutschsprachigen Amazon Marktplatz. Doch für uns ist das erst der Anfang, und deshalb bauen wir unser Team weiter aus.

Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d), der uns dabei unterstützt, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen und unsere Performance weiter zu optimieren.




Was wir bieten:

Ein dynamisches Unternehmen, das zu den führenden E-Commerce-Händlern auf Amazon im deutschsprachigen Raum zählt.
Ein vielfältiges und integratives Arbeitsumfeld, dass die Grundlage für nachhaltigen Geschäftserfolg bildet.
Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt
Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit einem Startfenster zwischen 6 und 10 Uhr, um die beste Work-Life-Balance zu ermöglichen.
Mobiles Arbeiten an 2 von 5 Tagen pro Woche – für mehr Flexibilität.
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte auf alle Produkte aus unserem Sortiment.
Über 1.500 Angebote durch unseren Partner Corporate Benefits.
Bezuschussung des Jobtickets
Und viele weitere Benefits




Deine Aufgaben:

Erstellung und Pflege interaktiver Dashboards in PowerBI, die klaren Einblicke und Handlungsempfehlungen bieten.
Aufbau und Optimierung von Datenmodellen auf Basis von Daten aus Amazon Seller Central und anderen relevanten Quellen.
Definition, Berechnung und Interpretation von Amazon-spezifischen KPIs wie Bestellungen, Conversion Rates und PPC-Performance.
Analyse von Trends, Mustern und Abweichungen, um proaktive Empfehlungen abzuleiten.
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Business-Teams, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu unterstützen.
Unterstützung bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung datengetriebener Strategien zur Optimierung der Geschäftsperformance.




Dein Profil:

Mindestens 2–3 Jahre Erfahrung mit dem Microsoft Fabric Tech Stack und PowerBI.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und SQL.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Amazon- und Marketplace-Daten.
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten klar und verständlich aufzubereiten.
Kommunikationsstärke und Teamfähigkeit, um datenbasierte Insights erfolgreich in Geschäftsentscheidungen einzubringen.







Wir freuen uns auf Deine Unterlagen und Dich kennenzulernen.

Show more

  • Ein vielfältiges und integratives Arbeitsumfeld, dass die Grundlage für nachhaltigen Geschäftserfolg bildet.
  • Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit einem Startfenster zwischen 6 und 10 Uhr, um die beste Work-Life-Balance zu ermöglichen.
  • Mobiles Arbeiten an 2 von 5 Tagen pro Woche – für mehr Flexibilität.
  • Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte auf alle Produkte aus unserem Sortiment.
  • Über 1.500 Angebote durch unseren Partner Corporate Benefits.
  • Bezuschussung des Jobtickets
  • Und viele weitere Benefits


Deine Aufgaben:

  • Erstellung und Pflege interaktiver Dashboards in PowerBI, die klaren Einblicke und Handlungsempfehlungen bieten.
  • Aufbau und Optimierung von Datenmodellen auf Basis von Daten aus Amazon Seller Central und anderen relevanten Quellen.
  • Definition, Berechnung und Interpretation von Amazon-spezifischen KPIs wie Bestellungen, Conversion Rates und PPC-Performance.
  • Analyse von Trends, Mustern und Abweichungen, um proaktive Empfehlungen abzuleiten.
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Business-Teams, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu unterstützen.
  • Unterstützung bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung datengetriebener Strategien zur Optimierung der Geschäftsperformance.


Dein Profil:

  • Mindestens 2–3 Jahre Erfahrung mit dem Microsoft Fabric Tech Stack und PowerBI.
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und SQL.
  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit Amazon- und Marketplace-Daten.
  • Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten klar und verständlich aufzubereiten.
  • Kommunikationsstärke und Teamfähigkeit, um datenbasierte Insights erfolgreich in Geschäftsentscheidungen einzubringen.



Wir freuen uns auf Deine Unterlagen und Dich kennenzulernen.

Title: Data & AI Strategist (f/m/d)
Description:
The role sits at the intersection of IT, business and innovation, developing data & AI strategies within Siemens IT, fundamentally supporting our business, leveraging Data, AI and GenAI to drive transformational change.

What We Offer You


An attractive renumeration package
Access to employee share plans
30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family
2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Diverse health and wellness offerings
Barrier-free locations


Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here.

The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions.

You’ll make an impact by


Data & AI Strategy Development
Developing and implementing data and AI strategies that align with our business and IT goals, driving strategic value and ensuring that our AI and data efforts have a measurable impact.
Leading the way in AI adoption — moving from initial experiments to fully scaled solutions that improve decision-making and efficiency.
Staying at the forefront of AI innovation, including emerging technologies like agentive AI, large language models, and autonomous systems.
Building and maintaining relationships with key technology partners, research institutions, and industry thought leaders.
AI & Data-Driven Operating Models
Designing operating models that leverage AI and data by integrating automation and predictive insights into our business processes.
Collaborating with business and IT leaders to embed AI and data capabilities into workflows, driving transformation and new business approaches.
Encouraging a culture of data-driven decision-making by ensuring that everyone has access to high-quality, well-governed data.
Developing and implementing change management strategies that support the transition to AI-enhanced operating models.
AI & Data Governance and Enablement
Helping to evolve our frameworks for AI and data governance to ensure that our solutions are scalable, ethical, and compliant.
Fostering AI and data literacy across Siemens by equipping teams with the skills and tools needed to effectively utilize AI and advanced analytics.
Collaboration & Influence
Working closely with relevant Centers of Excellence (CoEs) and internal innovation programs to define and standardize best practices, supporting the acceleration of AI adoption.
Engaging with senior leadership to influence decisions on AI and data investments, ensuring alignment with our long-term goals.
Supporting the continual development of our internal strategy capabilities — beyond just data & AI.


This Is How You'll Win Us Over


Education
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business, or a related field.
Experience & Skills
At least 5 years of experience in AI, data strategy, analytics, or digital transformation, with a strong track record of implementing AI and data projects on an enterprise scale.
Background in consulting, enterprise AI leadership, or AI-first startups.
Proven expertise in change management, guiding organizations through AI-driven transitions.
Strong problem-solving, strategic thinking, and program management abilities.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability for influencing senior executives and cross-functional teams.
Strong interest and extensive knowledge within the topics AI & Data.


You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!

Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

About Us

We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. That’s why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we’ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!

www.siemens.de/careers – if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ – if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)




Company Description




AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.




Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!










Job Description




Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company’s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities

Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.

Job Requirements

Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.










What do we offer?

Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
30 days of annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work




Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
About The Opportunity

As a Senior Finance Data Analyst, you will empower our Finance and Business teams to make data-driven decisions that are crucial to the company’s overall strategy. You will monitor, measure, and analyze financial metrics and performance, providing actionable insights to improve financial operations and business outcomes. Your role will foster a data-driven mindset within the Finance team and contribute to a culture of continuous improvement across the organization. You will work closely with finance leaders, product managers, other analysts, and cross-functional teams to ensure that finance is a key partner in driving the company’s success. As part of the cross-functional data analytics team, you will be working across our four product domains Grow & Engage, Everyday Banking, Banking Foundations and Financial Empowerment.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable financial KPIs, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Lead complex, high-impact financial analyses on a strategic level, delivering insights that influence key financial and business decisions.
Handle stakeholders: Serve as the go-to person for finance-related data and insights. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address finance-related queries and drive alignment on financial goals.
Evaluate initiatives: Support financial planning and analysis for strategic initiatives, including revenue forecasting, budgeting and cost optimization. Provide in-depth analysis on financial performance and deliver actionable insights.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Collaborate with technical teams to ensure the right data infrastructure is in place, enabling finance teams to access, visualize, and analyze financial data independently.
Provide monitoring tools: Build and maintain financial dashboards that track key performance indicators, ensuring alignment with the company’s financial targets and OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Lead initiatives to improve the organization’s understanding of financial data through training sessions and workshops, promoting a data-driven finance culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with other analysts and finance professionals across the organization to share insights, tools, and best practices.
Support some of the following finance & business team initiatives (not limited to):
Partner with business teams to discover new opportunities for cost-saving or revenue-generating initiatives by identifying financial trends and business opportunities.
Evaluate financial impact of ongoing business initiatives and product launches through comprehensive financial modeling and data analysis.
Ensure all financial data is properly tracked and recorded for future reporting and analysis, working with engineering and data teams to maintain accurate data collection systems.
Drive the quantitative analysis of financial performance, being responsible for delivering deep insights that help drive business strategy and operational improvements.

Background

What you need to be successful:

4+ years of experience in a finance or data analytics role, ideally within the FinTech or financial services sector.

Skills


Strong understanding of financial modeling, budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis.
Expertise in SQL and Python/R for financial data analysis.
Experience working with common data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) for financial reporting.
Solid understanding of financial statements and key financial metrics (e.g., profit & loss, balance sheet, cash flow).
Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to distil complex financial data into actionable insights for stakeholders.
Experience working in a high-growth startup or FinTech company, managing topics like financial reporting, cost optimization, or profitability analysis would be a plus
Experience with quantitative financial research and data-driven decision-making would be a plus.
Background in finance-focused product development or business partnership would be a plus


What’s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

Equal Opportunities

We recognize that our strength lies in our people and the varied perspectives they bring to our workforce. We strive to build talented and diverse teams to drive our business success and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We genuinely welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, neurodiversities, and ages. We're committed to creating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued and respected, free from harassment and discrimination. If there's anything you need to make the application process work for you, please let us know by reaching out to candidate.exp@n26.com.

Visit our website to learn more about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at N26.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.




Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.


Aufgaben


Deine Leidenschaft





Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kund:innen


Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren


Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung


Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen





Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.


Qualifikation


Dein Talent





Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)


Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung


Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics


Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin


Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil


Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region





Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!


Benefits


Unser Versprechen




Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.




Das erwartet Dich bei uns:





Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.


Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.


Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.


Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.


Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.


Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.


Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.


Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.


Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.





Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A




Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Show more

  • Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung
